instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PCH_INTRUDER_L: What is PCH_INTRUDER_L? PCH_INTRUDER_L is a signal that tells the machine the case has been opened by an intruder when it is low, the _L means it is present when it is low. This signal should always be high in a Macbook since it doesnâ€™t use intrusion detection. .
definitions.RTC_RESET_L: What is RTC_RESET_L? RTC_RESET_L is a reset signal that is present when the signal is low, the _L means it is asserted when the voltage is low. The RESET signal will keep the PCH from turning on or booting up the machine. .
definitions.PCH_INTVRMEN:
What is PCH_INTVRMEN? PCH_INTVRMEN is an Internal Voltage Regulator Enable: When pulled high, this signal enables
the internal 1.05 V regulators for the Suspend well in the PCH. This signal must
remain asserted for the VRMs to behave properly (no glitches allowed).
This signal must be pulled-up to VCCRTC on desktop platforms and may
optionally be pulled low on mobile platforms if using an external VR for the
VCCSUS rail.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBA weird shutdown issue
threads.message: So I have a really strange issue I have not encountered. I replaced a keyboard and track pad on a MacBook Air due to liquid damage and the machine starts up fine, the fan does not run at high RPM, when I run the Apple diagnostic test it doesn't report any sensor issues however the only way I can shut the computer down is by holding the power button with either the battery connected or the charger, but not both. when i attempt to shut it off with both it will simply "restart". If I shut down using OS it is the same deal, will only restart. has anyone ever experienced this before? I tried to use a different keyboard and same deal. Will only stay shutdown with power button held. I'm hoping we can solve this so others may learn.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBA weird shutdown issue
threads.message:
First of all, disconnect TP flex and see if you can turn off the board with <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/16 pads, instead of power button.
Post 820-XXXX (always required) if you really need help.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBA weird shutdown issue
threads.message: My fault it is an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. I will try that and post results

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBA weird shutdown issue
threads.message: Yeah I?m with 2informaticos sounds like corroded tpad, tpad cable, or keyboard

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBA weird shutdown issue
threads.message: Ok, tried the power on pads and get the same result. Board will act like it is off for 1.5 seconds then turns back on

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBA weird shutdown issue
threads.message:
What is the exact voltage for <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> signal?

Also post voltage for ALL (4) PCH's RTC signals.
Take you time and use search function on the forum, if you don't know which them are.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBA weird shutdown issue
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>RTC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>: 3.32v

<SIGNAL>PCH_SRTRST_L</SIGNAL>: 3.32v

<SIGNAL>PCH_INTRUDER_L</SIGNAL>: 3.08v

<SIGNAL>PCH_INTVRMEN</SIGNAL>: 3.23v

<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>: 3.45V

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBA weird shutdown issue
threads.message: Decided to measure the resistance of the resistors for these signals and <RESISTOR>R1302</RESISTOR> for <SIGNAL>PCH_INTVRMEN</SIGNAL> is reading 18k ohms vs the 330k it should be.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBA weird shutdown issue
threads.message:
Is the battery correctly recognized and charging?
Try known good battery; even old, just for test.
Also try known good LIO board/flex.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBA weird shutdown issue
threads.message:
Tried 2 different batteries, both are recognized and charging
changed LIO board/flex and same result

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBA weird shutdown issue
threads.message: Ok so I re-ran all of the power down tests again to make sure and it looks like any time the charger is plugged in it will not shut down normally. With only the battery plugged in it will shut down and stay off if I use either the power button on the keyboard or shut it down using MacOS. If I have the charger plugged in while shutting down the current will dip from .7 amps to .2 before starting up again with or without the battery plugged in. Seems to me like a charging circuit issue, although the battery is able to be charged.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBA weird shutdown issue
threads.message:
If charger is connected, doesn't stay off pressing power button 4-5 seconds?
Same issue if SSD is disconnected?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBA weird shutdown issue
threads.message: If I hold the power button the current drops to 400 milliamps and the computer will restart, with or without SSD

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBA weird shutdown issue
threads.message: I'm going to try to hold it for like 10 seconds but I'm sure it will just sit and wait for me to release then restart

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBA weird shutdown issue
threads.message: Also try disconnecting airport card.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBA weird shutdown issue
threads.message: ok, going to try that next. I held the power button down for 10 seconds then unplugged the speakers so it wouldn't wake up my kids restarting it a bunch of times and now it will stay off, but now when i plug in the charger the charger will not turn the computer on. Isn't the charger supposed to start the computer on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>? Will post back with results from removing airport card...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBA weird shutdown issue
threads.message: ok, now it starts normally when charger is plugged in but will not stay off when told to via MacOS. Oh and removing the Airport card seemed to do nothing...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBA weird shutdown issue
threads.message: I fell like I need to send a video b/c this seems unreal

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBA weird shutdown issue
threads.message: I just checked my receipt for the Trackpad, and it is for a 2013-2017 Air. This is a 2014. Could it be the trackpad? I mean the trackpad responds well to cursor movements. I'm at a loss here...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBA weird shutdown issue
threads.message:
Power button is not processed in the trackpad circuitry.
And I think you got same issue w/o trackapd, using directly <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/16 pads.

If now issue appears only from OSX, try new installation in other SSD; or USB test OSX, disconecting internal SSD.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBA weird shutdown issue
threads.message: Ok, So I replaced the SSD with another one and it seems to be working now... am able to shut it down with charger and battery plugged in, with MacOS and power button, with battery at full charge and drained (at like 75%) Guess I will chalk it up to an issue with the SSD and call this a win.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBA weird shutdown issue
threads.message: Probably OSX issue, just save data from old SSD and do fresh install on it.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBA weird shutdown issue
threads.message: Done, Thanks!
